column4: Hehe, Installed the LAMP pack now. But how to use/start it (can't find it in the apps list).
should be something like 'sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 start'   if apache isnt started already...
will that start all the apps in the pack or just the apache server.

You install the lamp stack in Synaptic or something I take it?  You may also need to restart MySQL as well, but last time I installed the LAMP stack they all were started for me, I just had to config them a bit.
Yes, in Synaptic. But can't see anything like a webserver here.
goto http://localhost and tell me what you see

Apache is running.  Which means PHP probably is as well, and MySQL should be, although I'm not sure how to test it.  The default web root is (I think) /var/www  so you may want to check out the files there.  Be careful with symlinks in that directory as well.
ok, so all those apps are auto loaded at startup?
the "it works" html file is in there "var/www". So how to configure it the mysql db and so on? MyPHPAdmin?
I use PHPMyAdmin, which is probably what you meant.  Yes, it should be in /var/www
yes I did, just forgot the name. But in WAMP PHPMyAdmin was in the pack, what about in the LAMP pack?
i think it is.  if its not, its very easy to install with synaptic.
How to find out if it's installed or not. It isn't checked as installed in Synaptic.
if its not check as installed in synaptic, its not installed.  go ahead and install it through synaptic
now it's done and I could simple navigate to http://localhost/phpmyadmin/ thx ;)
